title: New Tariffs Could Be Coming as WTO Rules for Boeing in Trade Fight
text:
The World Trade Organization ruled America can implement retaliatory tariffs on European imports because of subsidies to Boeing’s chief competitor Airbus. The news wouldn’t ordinarily be a big deal for markets, but in the current nervous climate it could stoke fears that Europe could represent a new front in the trade war.

The U.S. is authorized to tax up to $7.5 billion in European imports annually, based on Wednesday’s ruling. Trade with Europe totals nearly $1.3 trillion in 2018. Exports totaled $575 billion and imports...
